messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Its always a surprise
messages.msgSnippet: After the cold snap of 10 s for 2 or 3 weeks, 40 feels like spring. I hear the birds in the morning already, and I can smell the earth as its thawing.  I ve
messages.messageBody:
After the cold snap of 10's for 2 or 3 weeks, 40 feels like spring.

I hear the birds in the morning already, and I can smell the earth as its thawing. I've already seen robins, (I don't think they ever left this year), and the geese and flocks of birds have been around.

I think we're going to have an early spring this year (yeah!!!!!), and the Farmer's Almanac says that April and may will be warmer than usual.

Yahooooo!
Kristen

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Its always a surprise
messages.messageBody:
<<I'm ready for spring>>



But it snowed here last night!!!!!! We live just north of San Antonio and
we woke up to a beautiful dusting of snow. I was getting real tired of the
rain but I can do this for a day or two <grin>

Julie S.

messages.subject: Re: Its always a surprise
messages.msgSnippet: ... Eh... more like high 30 s, although the other day it was high 40 s and seemed practically summer-like :-/  It s 35 right now. I m about 40 minutes west of
messages.messageBody:
At 11:35 AM 02/14/2004, you wrote:
>Have y'all been holding in the low 40's?

Eh... more like high 30's, although the other day it was high 40's and
seemed practically summer-like :-/ It's 35 right now. I'm about 40 minutes
west of Gaithersburg, near Hagerstown - where I-70 and I-81 intersect,
about six miles from where the snipers were caught last year, and about 15
miles from Antietam Battlefield.

I'm ready for spring :-)

Marti
Smithsburg MD

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Its always a surprise
messages.msgSnippet: Maryland I believe MamaBeth J. Stauffer  wrote: Michelle (4) and Danny (5) have become quite proficient at loading up the computer games
messages.messageBody:
Maryland I believe

MamaBeth


"J. Stauffer" <jnjstau@...> wrote:
Michelle (4) and Danny (5) have become quite proficient at loading up the computer games they want to play. Apparently they are broadening their skills.

I turned on the computer and found that I now receive weather reports for a town called Gaithersburg. Anyone know where that is?

I also discovered all my files have been scanned for viruses. Something I didn't know how to do <grin>

Julie S.

messages.subject: Its always a surprise
messages.msgSnippet: Michelle (4) and Danny (5) have become quite proficient at loading up the computer games they want to play.  Apparently they are broadening their skills. I
messages.messageBody:
Michelle (4) and Danny (5) have become quite proficient at loading up the computer games they want to play. Apparently they are broadening their skills.

I turned on the computer and found that I now receive weather reports for a town called Gaithersburg. Anyone know where that is?

I also discovered all my files have been scanned for viruses. Something I didn't know how to do <grin>

Julie S.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
